required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Open-Label, Phase 1b Study of Acalabrutinib With and Without Dexamethasone in Subjects With Multiple Myeloma
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Phase 1b Study of ACP-196 With and Without Dexamethasone in Subjects With Multiple Myeloma

brief_summary.textblock: To characterize the safety profile of acalabrutinib with and without dexamethasone in subjects with relapsed or refractory Multiple Myeloma (MM)

primary_outcome.measure: Characterize the Safety Profile of Acalabrutinib With and Without Dexamethasone in Subjects With Relapsed or Refractory MM
primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug to within 30 days of last dose of study drug
primary_outcome.description: Safety was assessed by AEs, including SAEs and AEs of clinical interest; hematology, clinical chemistry and other laboratory variables; vital signs and ECOG PS scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Characterize the PK Profile of Acalabrutinib With and Without Dexamethasone and the PK Profile of Dexamethasone With Concomitant Acalabrutinib Administration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug to within 30 days of last dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: Noncompartmental PK parameters were calculated for acalabrutinib and dexamethasone based on plasma concentrations.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the Pharmacodynamic Effects of Acalabrutinib With and Without Dexamethasone
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug to within 30 days of last dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: BTK occupancy and B-cell activation were assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the Activity of Acalabrutinib With and Without Dexamethasone as Measured by ORR, DOR, Clinical Benefit Rate, Disease Control Rate, and PFS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug to within 30 days of last dose of study drug
secondary_outcome.description: ORR, DOR, clinical benefit rate, disease control rate and PFS as assessed by the investigator according to the current guidelines proposed by the International Myeloma Workshop Consensus Panel 1 (Rajkumar et al 2011) and European Group for Blood and Marrow Transplant (EBMT; Bladé et al 1998).

arm_group.description: Acalabrutinib 100 mg bid continuously and 40 mg dexamethasone once weekly

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women ≥ 18 years of age.
- A confirmed diagnosis of MM, which has relapsed after, or been refractory to ≥ 1 prior therapy for MM, and is progressing at the time of study entry.
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of ≤ 2.
- Agreement to use contraception during the study and for 30 days after the last dose of study drugs if sexually active and able to bear or beget children.
Exclusion Criteria:
- A life-threatening illness, medical condition or organ system dysfunction which, in the investigator's opinion, could compromise the subject's safety, interfere with the absorption or metabolism of acalabrutinib, or put the study outcomes at undue risk
- Significant cardiovascular disease such as uncontrolled or symptomatic arrhythmias, congestive heart failure, or myocardial infarction within 6 months of screening, or any Class 3 or 4 cardiac disease as defined by the New York Heart Association Functional Classification
- Malabsorption syndrome, disease significantly affecting gastrointestinal function, gastric bypass, resection of the stomach or small bowel, symptomatic inflammatory bowel disease, or partial or complete bowel obstruction.
- Breast feeding or pregnant

facility.name: Guys and St Thomas' Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Multicenter, open-label, randomized, parallel-group study to evaluate the safety, PK, PD and activity of acalabrutinib with and without dexamethasone in subjects with relapsed/refractory MM at 11 sites in US and UK. 27 subjects were enrolled and randomized into 2 cohorts. Enrollment was discontinued due to lack of efficacy.

group.title: Cohort 2
group.description: Acalabrutinib 100 mg bid continuously and 40 mg dexamethasone once weekly

drop_withdraw_reason.title: In agreement with patient, no benefit

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Site and PI can publish/publicly present the results of the study only with prior written consent of Sponsor or otherwise after expiry of 12 months following completion of the study. Site and PI agree to provide 30 days written notice to Sponsor prior to submission for publication or presentation.”
